message.content:
ethical relativism
cultural relativism
moral absolutism
moral objectivism
moral subjectivism
moral pluralism
moral universalism
moral nihilism
moral realism
moral relativity

Note: The terms "moral relativism" and "ethical relativism" are often used interchangeably, but some people use them to distinguish between different types or aspects of relativistic moral theories. The same applies to "moral absolutism" and "moral objectivism". "Moral relativity" is sometimes used to refer to a specific version of moral relativism that emphasizes the role of individual perspectives or contexts in moral judgments. The other terms are distinct but related concepts in moral philosophy.
